File /secure/simul_efun/add_command.c

Cotains some simul_efuns.

Written by Pinkfish

add_command(string, string, function)
A simul_efun for add_command.

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_command
varargs void add_command(string verb,
string pattern,
function func)
A simul_efun for add_command. This allows you to call add_command without having to go this_player()->add_command. This will only work on non-living objects.

Parameters:
verb - the verb to add
pattern - the pattern associated with the verb
func - the funvction to call on success
See also:
/global/new_parse->add_command() and help add_command_conversion .c
add_failed_mess
void add_failed_mess(mixed mess,
object * indir)
An interface to add_failed_mess. This is added to make life easier,m you do not need to call this_player()->add_failed_mess() if you are writing add_command code in a non-living object.

Parameters:
mess - the message to print
indir - the indirect objects the message is for
See also:
/global/new_parse->add_failed_mess()
add_succeeded_mess
void add_succeeded_mess(mixed mess,
object * indir)
An interface to add_succeeded_mess. This is added to make life easier,m you do not need to call this_player()->add_succeeded_mess() if you are writing add_command code in a non-living object.

Parameters:
mess - the message to print
indir - the indirect objects the message is for
add_succeeded_ob
void add_succeeded_ob(object ob)
An interface to add_succeeded. This is added to make life easier,m you do not need to call this_player()->add_succeeded() if you are writing add_command code in a non-living object.

Parameters:
ob - the object to add as succeeded
See also:
/global/new_parse->add_succeeded()
